title: Lewin lecture key-insight extraction
key_insights: Physics is presented as a structured way of seeing the world, not just formulas.
Intuition must be validated with quantitative reasoning and experiment.
The process is estimate first, then calculate, then compare with evidence.
Explicit assumptions and uncertainty tracking are essential for useful models.
Ignoring boundary conditions or measurement error can invalidate elegant math.
Disciplined thinking includes defining variables, checking units, and reality checks.
